Beans Curry in Udupi Style December 27, 2020 10 mins 10 mins 20 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Beans-curry-recipe-udupi-150x150.jpg Main Course, Side Dish Indian 4 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2020/12/beans-curry-in-udupi-style.html 1 cup Chopped beans?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#2 tsp Salt?&#2 tsp Jaggery?&#1 tbsp Tamarind?&#1.25 cups Cooked lentils?&#TO ROAST and GRIND?&#?&#2 tsp Coconut oil?&#1 tbsp Coriander seeds?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1/4 tsp Fenugreek seeds?&#3 no. Green chillies?&#1/4 tsp Asafoetida?&#1/4 cup Coconut?&#TO TEMPER?&#?&#2 tsp Coconut oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Cumin seeds Instructions?&#?&#In a pan, take 3 cups of chopped beans and some water. Add salt and let it cook.?&#?&#Next heat a pan adding oil, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, green chillies and asafoetida. Roast in medium flame for few seconds. Then add coconut and continue roasting. Grind all these ingredients with some water to fine paste.?&#?&#Next, add jaggery and tamarind water to veggie. Continue cooking till veggies turn soft. Then, add cooked lentils.?&#?&#Add prepared masala too and mix well. Adjust salt and bring it to nice boil.?&#?&#Delicious beans curry is ready to serve with hot steamed rice.
Mohan Laddu Recipe | Udupi Special Laddo November 27, 2020 30 mins 30 mins
https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/mohan-laddu-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian
Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/mohan-laddu-recipe-udupi-special-laddo 1 cup Maida (refined flour)?&#1 tbsp Rice flour?&#1 tbsp Ghee?&#1/4 tsp Salt?&#1 cup Sugar?&#1/2 cup Water?&#1/2 tsp Cardamom powder?&#2 tbsp Cashews?&#1 tbsp Raisins Instructions?&#?&#In a bowl, add refined flour, rice flour, salt and ghee. Give a mix. Add water little by little and knead stiff dough.?&#?&#Let the dough rest for 30 minutes. Make small balls and roll very thin chapati. Try to roll as thin as possible.?&#?&#Deep fry the pooris in hot oil in low flame. Fry little longer, so that it turns crisp. When all pooris are done, break them in to small pieces.?&#?&#Mean while roast cashews and raisins in little ghee and add to the powdered mix. Add cardamom powder too. Next, in a wide wok, add sugar and water. Let it cook in medium flame. When sugar dissolves and syrup turns in to one string consistency, switch off flame.?&#?&#Transfer the syrup to laddu mix little by little and combine well. Shape like laddu.?&#?&#Delicious mohan laddu is ready to serve.
Soppu Palya Recipe | Postpartum Recipes October 25, 2020 5 mins 10 mins 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/soppu-palya-recipe-150x150.jpg
Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2020/10/soppu-palya-recipe-postpartum-recipes.html 2 bunch Palak leaves?&#1 no. Onion?&#1/2 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Pepper powder?&#To Temper?&#?&#2 tsp Ghee?&#1/2 tsp Cumin seeds?&#few Curry leaves Instructions?&#?&#Clean the greens and chop them finely. In a pan, add ghee, cumin seeds and curry leaves. Sauté till cumin turns bit brown.?&#?&#Next, add chopped onion and sauté till turns translucent.?&#?&#Add the chopped greens, salt and pepper powder. Mix well and cook covered.?&#?&#Within 10 minutes, the greens would have cooked. Switch off and serve hot.?&#?&#Soppu palya for nursing mothers is ready to be served.
Bele Saaru | Hesaru Bele Saaru Recipe For New Mom October 10, 2020 5 mins 20 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Bele-Saaru-for-nursing-moth-150x150.jpg Main Course, Side Dish Indian 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2020/10/bele-saaru-hesaru-bele-saaru-recipe-for-new-mom.html 1/2 cup Split green gram lentils (moong)?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1 tsp Black Pepper?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#1 tbsp Garlic chopped?&#1 tbsp ghee?&#Few Curry leaves?&#1/2 piece Lemon Instructions?&#?&#Rinse the lentils with enough water and transfer to pressure cooker. Add 2 cups of water, turmeric powder and cook till soft.?&#?&#In a pan, add 1/2 tbsp of ghee, pepper and cumin seeds. Roast in low flame till fragrant. Transfer to mortar and powder it using pestle.?&#?&#Mash the cooked lentils till soft and transfer to cooking pan. Add powdered cumin plus pepper, salt and curry leaves. Bring it to boil.?&#?&#Finally squeeze lemon and switch off. Next, heat a pan adding ghee and chopped garlic. Roast for a minute and pour the tempering to saaru.?&#?&#This bele saaru is very comforting side dish with steamed rice for a new mom.
RAVA GANJI | POSTPARTUM RECIPES | ಬಾಣಂತಿ ಆಹಾರ September 20, 2020
10 mins 10 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/RAVA-GANJI-150x150.jpg New MOM food Indian 1 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2020/09/rava-ganji-postpartum-recipes-%e0%b2%ac%e0%b2%be%e0%b2%a3%e0%b2%82%e0%b2%a4%e0%b2%bf-%e0%b2%86%e0%b2%b9%e0%b2%be%e0%b2%b0.html 2 tbsp Rava (sooji)?&#1 cup Water?&#8 nos. Almond?&#1 tbsp Sugar?&#1/2 cup Milk Instructions?&#?&#Take the almonds in a mixer and powder it finely. Keep aside. Next heat a sauce pan and boil a cup of water.?&#?&#Meanwhile, dry roast the rava in a pan for a minute or so. Let it not change color. Slowly add roasted rave to boiling water and keep stirring.?&#?&#Add sugar, powdered almond and warm milk to this, one after the other. Cook it for 2 to 3 minutes and switch off.?&#?&#This rava ganji is healthy and easily digestible to new moms after childbirth.
Aval Laddu | Poha Laddu Recipe | Avalakki Unde August 26, 2020 10 mins 10 mins
https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Poha-laddu-150x150.jpg Dessert, laddu Indian 10 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/poha-laddu-recipe-avalakki-unde.html 2 cups Rice flakes?&#1 tbsp Ghee?&#2 tbsp Cashews broken?&#2 tbsp Raisins?&#1/2 cup Dry coconut?&#3/4 cup Jaggery?&#1/2 tsp Cardamom powder Instructions?&#?&#Heat a wide pan and roast the rice flakes till they turn crisp. Transfer to mixer and powder it very finely. Transfer this powder to a wide bowl.?&#?&#Next heat a pan and add ghee plus cashews. Roast them for few seconds. Add raisins and dry coconut. Roast them all for few more seconds and transfer to same bowl.?&#?&#Next heat jaggery adding 1/4 cup of water. Let jaggery dissolve completely and boil for a second. No need of checking consistency.?&#?&#Transfer this jaggery syrup to bowl. Add cardamom powder too. Mix them all we and make laddu.?&#?&#Easy and quick laddu is ready to serve as after school snack.
Rice Fritters | Crispy Snack July 31, 2020 10 mins 10 mins
https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/rice-fritters-150x150.jpg Snack Indian
Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/rice-fritters-crispy-snack.html 1 cup Rice flour?&#1 cup Water?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#3/4 tsp Salt?&#1 tbsp Oil?&#1 tbsp curry leaves chopped?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder?&#1/4 tsp Asafoetida (hing)?&#2 cups Oil for deep fry Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding water, cumin, salt and oil. Bring it to boil. Include a cup of rice flour and let boil for a minute. Put off flame and mix well.?&#?&#When it is still warm, knead a stiff dough. Cover and let it rest for 10 minutes. Next add red chilly powder, curry leaves and asafoetida. Knead again.?&#?&#Divide the dough in to 30 equal parts. Roll a ball in to flat disc and mark circular shape using cookie cutter or lid. Keep the balls covered till rolling is finished.?&#?&#Deep fry the fritters till golden brown.?&#?&#Crispy rice fritters are ready to munch all the day.
White Kurma | White Veg Kurma Restaurant Style June 22, 2020 15 mins 15 mins 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/white-kurma-recipe-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian 4 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/white-kurma-white-veg-kurma-recipe-restaurant-style 1 tbsp oil?&#2 nos Bay leaf?&#1" piece Cinnamon?&#1/4 cup Onion sliced?&#1/2 cup Beans chopped?&#1/4 cup Carrot chopped?&#1/4 cup Potato cubed?&#1/4 cup Fresh peas?&#3/4 tsp Salt?&#1/4 tsp Sugar?&#1.5 cup Water?&#!To Grind?&#?&#1/2 cup Coconut?&#2 nos Green chillies?&#1/2" piece Ginger?&#1 tbsp Roasted gram?&#1/4 tsp Fennel seeds?&#1/2" piece Cinnamon?&#1 no Cardamom?&#6 no Cashews?&#1/4 cup Water Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding oil, cinnamon and bay leaf. Saute a while and include onion slices. Saute till they turn translucent. Next, add all the veggies, beans, carrot, potato and peas.?&#?&#Saute the veggies too for 5 minutes. Next add a cup of water, salt and sugar. Let it cook till the veggies are soft.?&#?&#When veggies are cooking, grind the ingredients mentioned under "to grind" list.?&#?&#Transfer the ground paste to cooked veggies and mix well. Adjust salt and bring it to boil. Put off flame.?&#?&#Creamy and delicious white kurma is ready to serve with Poori, chapati and dosa.
Uddina Sandige | Ashgourd Fryum Recipe May 25, 2020 3 d
3 d https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Ashgourd-sandige-150x150.jpg Fryum, Papad Indian 100 gm Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/uddina-sandige-ashgourd-fryum-recipe 1/2 cup Split black gram lentils?&#4 nos. Green chillies?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1/2 tsp Asafoetida?&#1 cup Ash gourd grated?&#1 tsp Salt Instructions?&#?&#Take the lentils in a bowl and rinse it well with enough water and soak for 2 to 3 hours.?&#?&#Next add green chillies, cumin seeds, asafoetida and salt in to a mixer. Grind it to puree adding little water. Grate a piece of ash gourd and keep a cup of grated veggie ready.?&#?&#Next add soaked lentils in to the mixer and grind to semi thick paste.?&#?&#Ensure the batter doesn't become watery. Add water carefully. Transfer the batter to a bowl and beat for a while so that it becomes airy.?&#?&#Next add the ground puree and grated ash gourd to the batter. Mix well. You can taste and adjust spices now. It should be spicy with nice flavor of asafoetida.?&#?&#On a clean cotton cloth, drop the batter as small fryums. Let the fryum be little thick and place at equal distance. Sun dry them for 2 to 3 days till they turn completely moisture free. Store them in airtight container.?&#?&#When required, you can shallow fry or deep fry the fryums and relish with rice.
Instant Medu Vada | Instant Vada Recipe April 27, 2020 5 mins 10 mins 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/instant-medu-vada-150x150.jpg Breakfast, Snack Indian 6 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/instant-medu-vada-instant-vada-recipe 1/2 cup Rice flour?&#1/2 cup Yogurt?&#1/2 cup Water?&#1/2 tsp Salt?&#1 tbsp Ginger grated?&#2 tsp Green chillies?&#1 tbsp Curry leaves?&#2 tbsp Coriander leaves Instructions?&#?&#In a bowl take yogurt and water. Whisk them together well.?&#?&#Next add rice flour and make lump-less batter. Next add grated ginger, chopped green chillies, curry leaves and salt.?&#?&#Mix them together and transfer to cooking pan. With constant stirring, cook it in medium flame. It thickens and comes together.?&#?&#Add chopped coriander leaves and mix well. When dough is thick enough to make ball, switch off flame and transfer to a plate.?&#?&#Next shape the medu vada and drop in to hot oil one by one. Deep fry till golden brown and relish with tea/coffee.?&#?&#Crispy instant medu vada is ready to serve.
Batata Sukke | Potato Dry Sabji | Konkani Recipes April 7, 2020 10 mins 10 mins 20 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Batata-sukke-potato-dry-sabji-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian 4 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/batata-sukke-potato-dry-sabji-konkani-recipes 4 nos. Potatoes Cooked and chopped in to cubes?&#2 nos. Tomatoes chopped in to cubes?&#1 tsp Salt?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1 tsp Mustard seeds?&#few Curry leaves?&#To grind?&#?&#1/2 cup Grated coconut?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#2 inch Ginger?&#1/4 cup Coriander leaves?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder Instructions?&#?&#In a mixer, add fresh coconut, green chillies, ginger, turmeric powder and coriander leaves. Without adding water, grind them together coarsely.?&#?&#Next, heat a pan with oil, mustard, cumin seeds and curry leaves. Let them splutter. Add chopped tomatoes and saute well for at least 4 minutes.?&#?&#Next, add ground coconut masala and mix very well.?&#?&#Add cooked potato cubes and give a nice mix. Potato Peas Kurma | Aloo Matar Kurma Sweet Version January 7, 2020
20 mins 20 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Potato-peas-kurma-1-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian, Karnataka 4 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/potato-peas-kurma-aloo-matar-kurma-sweet-version 1.5 cup Soaked peas?&#1 cup Potato cubes?&#1 no. Onion medium sized?&#2 tsp Jaggery?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Coriander powder?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder?&#1/4 cup copra (dry coconut)?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#2 nos. Bay leaf Instructions?&#?&#Take soaked peas in a pressure cooker and add a cup of water and little salt. Pressure cook the peas for 3 whistles and simmer for 5 minutes.?&#?&#Heat oil in a cooking pan. Throw in cumin and bay leaf. Let the cumin crackle. Then include chopped onion and saute till onion turns translucent.?&#?&#Next, add potato cubes, water and salt. Aloo Bonda in Appe Pan | Low Calorie Aloo Bonda December 23, 2019 15 mins 20 mins 35 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/IMG_8474-001-150x150.jpg Snack Indian 14 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/aloo-bonda-in-appe-pan-low-calorie-aloo-bonda 3 nos. Potatoes?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#1" piece Ginger?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1/2 tsp Salt?&#2 tbsp Coriander leaves?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp White lentils?&#1/2 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1 tbsp Curry leaves?&#For batter?&#?&#1 cup Gram flour?&#1 tbsp Rice flour?&#1/2 tsp Salt?&#1/2 tsp Red chilly powder?&#1/4 tsp Asafoetida Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, black gram lentils and curry leaves. Saute and let the mustard splutter. Next include finely chopped green chillies and ginger. Continue sauteing.?&#?&#Next include cooked and mashed potato, salt, turmeric powder and mix well. Finally add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves. Now stuffing is ready. Let it cool down.?&#?&#In a wide bowl add gram flour, rice flour, salt, red chilly powder and asafoetida. Give a quick mix.?&#?&#Adding water little by little, make a thick yet flowing consistency batter.?&#?&#Now make lemon sized balls from stuffing and keep it ready.?&#?&#Heat appe pan and add 1/2 tsp oil in to each dent. Now dip the stuffing ball in to batter such it coats well on it. Then place it in to each dent. Let it cook in medium flame for 2 minutes. Flip the other side as well.?&#?&#Healthy and low calorie snack all bonda is ready to serve with coconut chutney and tomato ketchup.
Pineapple Dosa | Pineapple Dose Recipe December 8, 2019 3 hrs 15 mins 11 hrs 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/pineapple-dosa-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian, Karnataka 10 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/pineapple-dosa-pineapple-dose-recipe 1.5 cups Raw rice?&#1 tsp Fenugreek seeds?&#1/2 cup Rice flakes?&#1.5 cups Pineapple cubes?&#1/2 cup Coconut?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#Oil as needed Instructions?&#?&#Take rice and fenugreek seeds together in a wide bowl, add enough water and rinse two to three times. Add fresh water and soak it for 3 to 4 hours. Also soak rice flakes separately.?&#?&#Next, add pineapple cubes and coconut in to a mixer and grind finely.?&#?&#Include soaked rice and rice flakes as well to the same and grind together to fine batter. Add water only if needed.?&#?&#Transfer the batter to bowl and let it ferment for 8-10 hours. After fermentation, add salt and water if needed. Mix well and the batter is ready.?&#?&#Next, heat a griddle and pour ladle full batter at the center. Spread like dosa and cook covered for 2 minutes.?&#?&#Pineapple dosa is ready to serve with coconut chutney.
Rice Bath | Vegetable Rice Bath in Karnataka Style November 25, 2019 20 mins 15 mins 35 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/rice-bath-150x150.jpg Main Course Indian, Karnataka 5 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/rice-bath-vegetable-rice-bath-in-karnataka-style 1.5 cup Rice?&#1/4 cup carrot chopped?&#1/4 cup beans chopped?&#2 tbsp Green peas fresh or frozen?&#1/4 cup onion chopped?&#1/4 cup tomato chopped?&#1.5 tsp salt?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#2 tsp Lemon juice?&#To grind?&#?&#6 cloves Garlic?&#2" piece Ginger?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#2" piece cinnamon?&#4 nos Cloves?&#1 no. Cardamom?&#1 tsp Fennel seeds?&#1 tsp Coriander seeds?&#2 tbsp Coconut?&#1 tbsp Mint leaves?&#To temper?&#?&#1 tbsp Ghee?&#1 tbsp oil?&#1 no. bay leaf?&#1" piece cinnamon?&#4 nos. cloves?&#2 nos. cardamom Instructions?&#?&#Take rice in a vessel and rinse it 3 to 4 times with enough water and soak it for 15-20 minutes. Next in a pan add oil, garlic, ginger, green chillies, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, fennel seeds and coriander seeds. Saute well for few minutes till all are roasted. Next include coconut and mint leaves and continue sauteing for few seconds.?&#?&#Transfer all the roasted ingredients to mixer and grind to fine puree along with water. Next, heat a pressure cooker adding ghee, oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves and cardamom. Saute for few seconds.?&#?&#Next, include onion and continue sauteing till onion turn translucent. Next add tomato and saute till mushy.?&#?&#When tomatoes are done, add ground masala. Saute till raw smell subsides. Now, add all the veggies and mix well.?&#?&#Next include 3 cups of water, soaked rice, salt and turmeric powder.?&#?&#Give a nice stir, squeeze a lemon and pressure cook for 3 whistles. When the pressures subsides naturally, open the lid and serve.?&#?&#Healthy and tasty rice bath is ready to serve with raita.
Cucumber Curry | Southekai Hasi Gojju Recipe November 17, 2019 10 mins 5 mins 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/cucumber-curry-southekai-hasi-gojju-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian, Karnataka 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/cucumber-curry-southekai-hasi-gojju-recipe 2 nos. Cucumber (medium sized)?&#1/2 cup Coconut?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#3 tsp Sesame seeds?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1/2 cup Yogurt?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Cooking oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Black gram lentils?&#Few Curry leaves Instructions?&#?&#Chop the cucumber in to tiny pieces and keep aside. Next heat a pan and add all the tempering ingredients along with a tsp of sesame seeds. When it sizzles, include chopped cucumber and saute for 3 minutes or till it cooks.?&#?&#Transfer the sauteed cucumber in to a vessel and let it cool down. Next in a mixer, add coconut, green chillies and 2 tsp of sesame seeds.?&#?&#With little water, grind it to fine puree. Add this puree to sauteed cucumber. Include yogurt and salt too.?&#?&#Mix everything together. This is ready to serve.?&#?&#Scrumptious cucumber curry (southekai hasi gojju) is ready in 15 minutes.
Rava Kheer | Suji ki kheer Recipe November 9, 2019 5 mins 15 mins 20 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Rava-kheer-150x150.jpg Dessert Karnataka 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/rava-kheer-suji-ki-kheer-recipe 1 tbsp Fine rava (semolina)?&#2.5 cups Milk?&#1/8 cup Sugar?&#1 tbsp Ghee?&#1 tbsp Raisins?&#1 tbsp Cashews?&#1/4 tsp Cardamom powder Instructions?&#?&#Take 1/2 tbsp of ghee in a pan and heat it in medium flame. When it melts, include raisins followed by cashews. Roast them for few seconds and keep aside till use.?&#?&#Next add remaining ghee and roast rava with constant stirring. It may take few minutes. When the rava becomes aromatic transfer it. Next add milk and bring it to boil.?&#?&#When the milk boils for few minutes, then include roasted rava to it. Let it cook for few minutes.?&#?&#Milk thickens and reduces, then include sugar. Let it dissolve completely. Finally add cardamom powder and garnish with roasted raisins and cashews.?&#?&#Delicious rava kheer is ready to serve.
WHEAT HALWA | GODHI HALWA | UDUPI STYLE October 26, 2019 2 d 1 hr 30 mins 2 d 1 hr 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/wheat-halwa-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian, Karnataka 16 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/wheat-halwa-godhi-halwa-udupi-style.html 1 cup Whole wheat?&#2.5 cup Sugar?&#1/4 tsp Orange food color?&#1 cup Ghee?&#2 tbsp Cashews?&#2 tsp Cardamom seeds Instructions?&#?&#Take whole wheat in a wide bowl and rinse it many times. Soak it for 1 day in enough water. Then drain all the water and add it to mixer. Along with a cup of water, grind it to fine batter.?&#?&#Next, strain the batter using fine strainer and collect thick extract of wheat. Transfer the wheat residue to mixer again.?&#?&#Adding sufficient water grind it again to fine puree. Strain it again and collect it's extract in the same way.?&#?&#Let this collected wheat extract rest for a day. It will ferment and water floats above. Discard all the water and add a cup of fresh water. Mix well and bring it to the consistency of neeru dosa batter.?&#?&#Next heat a heavy bottom pan adding sugar and a cup of water. Let the sugar dissolve in low flame. Then carefully include wheat batter prepared above.?&#?&#Start cooking in medium flame with continuous stirring. It will begin to thicken. Include food color and continue stirring.?&#?&#Add cashew pieces, cardamom seeds and continue stirring.?&#?&#Next at regular intervals add ghee and keep stirring till it reaches the halwa consistency. It may take 1 hour to 1.30 hours. Squeeze a small lemon in between. At the final stage the mixture oozes ghee and it holds shape.?&#?&#Transfer to a tray and let it rest for 1 hour and then mark pieces.?&#?&#Tasty and delicious wheat halwa is ready to serve on this Diwali festival.
Kaju Barfi | Kaju Burfi | Cashew Barfi Recipe October 17, 2019 10 mins 40 mins 50 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kaju-barfi-kaju-burfi-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian 12 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/kaju-barfi-kaju-burfi-cashew-barfi-recipe 3/4 cup Cashew (kaju)?&#3/4 cup Sugar?&#3/4 cup Milk?&#2 tbsp Ghee Instructions?&#?&#Take cashews in a wide bowl and soak them in enough water for about 30 minutes. Cashews turn soft and tender after soaking. Add them to mixer.?&#?&#Grind the soaked cashews along with milk to fine paste. While grinding include milk little by little. The consistency should be like dosa batter. Transfer this to a pan. Add sugar and start cooking in medium flame.?&#?&#As you cook, the mixture begins to thicken. After stirring for about 20-25 minutes, it comes together like dough.?&#?&#Take a small portion and check it holds shape or not. If so, switch off. Place the pan over kitchen counter and add 1 tbsp of ghee. Stir well. Again include one more tbsp of ghee and continue mixing.?&#?&#Now the mixture is like stiff dough. Transfer this to a tray and level it up. Let it sit for about 1 to 2 hours. Then mark pieces.?&#?&#Scrumptious kaju barfi is ready to serve on Diwali festival.
MILK PEDA | DOODH PEDA RECIPE | NO CONDENSED MILK October 9, 2019 10 mins 1 hr 30 mins 1 hr 40 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Doodh-peda-milk-peda-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian 8 pieces Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/milk-peda-doodh-peda-recipe 1.5 litre Milk?&#1/4 cup Sugar?&#1/4 tsp Cardamom powder Instructions?&#?&#Take milk in a heavy bottom pan and bring it to boil. Continue cooking in medium flame but stir occasionally. Otherwise bottom will burn.?&#?&#After 30 minutes of boiling, milk turn thick and reduces to half. When it gathers like milk solid, include sugar. Mix well and continue cooking in low flame.?&#?&#Sugar makes the mixture thin. After 15 minutes of cooking again it will come together like mass. Then include cardamom powder and mix.?&#?&#When the mixture holds shape, transfer it to a plate.?&#?&#Take small portion and shape like peda. Using fork, you can give a design on the same.?&#?&#Dairy based sweet milk peda or doodh peda is ready.
INSTANT LEMON SEVAI | LEMON SEMIYA | SHAVIGE September 30, 2019 5 mins 20 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/instant-lemon-sevai-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian 3 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/instant-lemon-sevai-lemon-semiya-lemon-shavige 1 cup Fine rava?&#2 cups Water?&#1 tsp Salt?&#! To temper?&#?&#3 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Split black gram (urad dal)?&#few Curry leaves?&#1 tbsp peanuts?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#1 tbsp Cashews optional?&#1/2 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1/4 tsp Salt or to taste?&#1/2 Lemon?&#2 tbsp Fresh coconut?&#1 tbsp Coriander leaves chopped Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding 2 cups of water. Add salt. Bring it to rolling boil. Stirring continuously add fine rava.?&#?&#Mix the rava in water such that no lumps are formed. Cook it for 2 to 3 minutes until all water is absorbed and mixture becomes thick. Transfer it to a plate and let it slightly cool down.?&#?&#Next, grease some oil to palm and knead the rava mixture. Divide it in to two portions. Fill in a portion in to shavige (idiyappam) press.?&#?&#On idli plate, press the shavige like small idlis. Place all the plates in a steamer and cook for 5 to 10 minutes. Let them cool down completely.?&#?&#Next heat a pan add oil, mustard seeds, lentils, curry leaves. Saute till the mustard sizzle. Include peanuts, cashews, slit green chillies, turmeric powder and continue sauteing few more minutes. Adjust salt now.?&#?&#Next, break the shavige in to this tempering pan and give a nice mix. Squeeze lemon and garnish with coconut and coriander leaves. Instant lemon sevai is ready to serve.
Veg Kurma | Vegetable Kurma | Restaurant Style September 15, 2019 15 mins 15 mins 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Veg-kurma-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian 4 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/veg-kurma-vegetable-kurma-restaurant-style.html 2 Cup Mixed Vegetables Beans, carrot, peas and potato?&#1 no. Onion?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder?&#1/2 tsp Coriander powder?&#1/2 tsp Garam masala?&#1 tbsp Yogurt?&#1 tsp Sugar?&#To Grind?&#?&#1/2 cup Coconut?&#2 tbsp Cashew soaked for 10 minutes?&#1 tsp Poppy seeds soaked for 10 minutes?&#1" piece Cinnamon?&#3 nos Cloves?&#1 no. Cardamom?&#1 no. Red chilly?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1" piece Cinnamon?&#3 nos. Cloves?&#1 no. Bay leaf Instructions?&#?&#Chop all the veggies in to bite sized pieces and add them to cooker. Include water and little salt. Pressure cook the vegetable for 2 whistles and let the pressure subside.?&#?&#Next, add coconut, soaked cashew and poppy seeds, red chilly, cinnamon stick, cardamom and cloves in to a mixer. Grind them together to fine paste.?&#?&#Heat a pan with oil and spices like cinnamon, cloves and bay leaf. Saute a minute and then include chopped onion. When it turns translucent add cooked vegetables. Stir for a while and add ground kurma masala.?&#?&#Next add salt, red chilly powder, coriander powder, garam masala. Combine well and bring it to boil. Next add yogurt and sugar.?&#?&#Stir for a minute and finally garnish the veg kurma with coriander leaves.?&#?&#Creamy delicious veg kurma in restaurant style is ready.
Methi Idli | Vendhaya Idli | Menthe Idli Recipe September 11, 2019 4 hrs 15 mins 14 hrs 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Methi-dili-menthe-idli-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian 15 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/09/methi-idli-vendhaya-idli-menthe-idli-recipe.html 2 cups Raw Rice?&#2 tbsp Fenugreek seeds?&#2 tsp Salt?&#Water as needed Instructions?&#?&#Take raw rice in a wide bowl and rinse well with enough water. Soak it for about 4 hours. Similarly rinse and soak the fenugreek seeds separately.?&#?&#After soaking, fenugreek seeds would have doubled in size. Add it to mixer and grind very finely. While grinding, add water in steps and ensure you obtain pouring consistency batter.?&#?&#Transfer the fenugreek batter to bowl and add soaked rice in to the same mixer. Add required water and grind it to little coarse batter. Transfer it to the same bowl.?&#?&#Mix both the batter evenly and let it ferment for 10 hours. Next add salt and pour batter to the idli mould. Steam cook for 15 minutes.?&#?&#Very healthy and soft methi idli (vendhaya idli) is ready to serve chutney and sambar.
Sambar Vada | Vada Sambar | Vadai Sambar August 28, 2019 2 hrs 30 mins 30 mins 3 hrs https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Sambar-vada-150x150.jpg Breakfast, Snack Indian 8 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/sambar-vada-vada-sambar-vadai-sambar For vada?&#?&#1 cup Split black gram (urad dal)?&#1 tbsp Fine rava?&#2 tsp Green chillies chopped finely?&#1 tbsp Curry leaves chopped finely?&#1 tbsp Coriander leaves chopped finely?&#1 tbsp Fresh coconut chopped?&#1.5 tsp Ginger chopped finely?&#1 tsp Salt?&#3 cup Oil to deep fry?&#For sambar?&#?&#1/2 cup Split pigeon pea (Toor dal)?&#1 cup Drumstick?&#1/2 cup Shallots?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#1" piece cinnamon?&#1 nos. Onion chopped?&#2 tbsp Fresh grated coconut?&#3 tsp Sambar powder?&#1 tsp Tamarind paste?&#1 tsp Jaggery?&#1 tbsp Coriander leaves chopped?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Split blackgram?&#Few Curry leaves?&#1 no. Red chilly broken Instructions?&#?&#Rinse the split black gram lentils with enough water and soak for at least 2 hours. After soaking the lentils would be doubled in volume. Next drain all water and transfer to mixer. Include 3 table spoons of water and grind finely.?&#?&#The batter should be fluffy and thick. So add water carefully. Take the batter in a wide bowl and add salt, medium rava, chopped coconut, ginger, chillies, curry leaves and coriander leaves. Mix everything together.?&#?&#Meanwhile heat oil in a wok in medium flame. Next, with damp fingers take a big lemon sized batter and make a hole at the center using thumb. Carefully drop the vada in to hot oil. Deep fry till golden brown. Continue the process till you empty the batter.?&#?&#To prepare sambar, take chopped drumstick and shallots in a cooking vessel. Add some water, turmeric powder and salt. Let it cook in medium flame till soft.?&#?&#Heat pan adding oil, cinnamon, sliced onion and grated coconut. Roast them together till onion turns translucent. Transfer them to mixer and add sambar powder to it.?&#?&#Grind all the ingredients to fine paste along with little water. The veggies would have turned soft in 10 minutes.?&#?&#Include tamarind water, jaggery to the veggies and let it cook for 3 minutes.. Next add ground masala to the same.?&#?&#Add cooked toor dal and water to adjust consistency. Bring it to boil and add coriander leaves. You can adjust salt also at this stage. Finally temper with mustard seeds, lentils and curry leaves.?&#?&#Amazingly delicious sambar vada is ready to serve as breakfast or snack.
Dry Fruit Barfi | Dry Fruit Burfi | No Sugar, No Jaggery August 24, 2019 1 hr 10 mins 5 mins 1 hr 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/dry-fruit-barfi-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian 10 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/dry-fruit-barfi-dry-fruit-burfi-no-sugar 1 cup Dates seedless?&#1/2 cup Cashew + Pistachio + Walnut?&#1/2 cup Almonds?&#2 tsp Ghee?&#1/2 tsp Cardamom powder?&#1/2 tsp Poppy seeds Instructions?&#?&#Take the seedless dates in mixer and grind it coarsely. Do not add any water. You can use pulse mode to grind.?&#?&#Next, heat a pan with ghee. Add ground dates paste and saute for 5 minutes. The raw smell subsides and the mixture turns like dough. Next take the nuts (cashew+ pistachio+walnut) in a mixer and whirl to coarse powder.?&#?&#Similarly coarsely grind almonds and keep it ready. Transfer the sauteed dates in a bowl.?&#?&#Add powdered nuts and almonds to the same bowl. Mix well with your fingers. Sprinkle poppy seeds all over and roll it over baking sheet.?&#?&#Cover it with same sheet and refrigerate for an hour. Then cut in to pieces.?&#?&#This sugar free dry fruit barfi is healthy and nutritious. It last longer as well.
Rava Chakli | Instant Chakli | Instant Murukku August 20, 2019 10 mins 20 mins 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/instant-chakli-rava-chakli-150x150.jpg Snack Indian 20 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/instant-chakli-rava-chakli-instant-murukku 1 cup Fine rava (semolina)?&#1 cup Water?&#1.25 tsp Salt?&#1 tbsp Butter?&#1 cup Rice flour?&#2 tsp Sesame seeds?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder?&#2 cups Oil to deep fry Instructions?&#?&#Heat a cup of water in a pan with little salt. When it boils, include fine rava and keep stirring. Break the lumps and cook till it comes together like dough. Add butter and mix well.?&#?&#When the dough leaves pan, switch off and transfer it to bowl. Next add rice flour to it.?&#?&#Add salt, sesame seeds and red chilly powder. Combine everything together to crumbled form. Next add water incrementally little by little and knead a stiff and soft dough.?&#?&#Take the chakli press and grease some oil. Fill the chakli dough up to the brim and press the chakli on baking sheet. Keep a batch chakli ready.?&#?&#Meanwhile heat oil in heavy bottom wok, when it heats up, carefully remove the chakli and drop in to hot oil for deep frying. Fry till golden brown and remove from oil.?&#?&#Crispy instant chakli is ready to relish as tea time snack.
Girmit | Masala Mandakki | North Karnataka Special August 17, 2019 15 mins 10 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Girmit-masala-mandakki-150x150.jpg Snack Karnataka 4 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/girmit-masala-mandakki-north-karnataka-special 3 cup Puffed rice?&#1/3 cup Onion chopped?&#1/4 cup Tomato chopped?&#1/4 cup Coriander leaves chopped?&#1/2 cup Nylon sev?&#1/4 cup Roasted gram (putani)?&#For girmit masala powder?&#?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1 tsp Coriander seeds?&#1" piece Cinnamon stick?&#3 nos Cloves?&#For girmit masla?&#?&#2 tbsp Oil?&#1 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#Few Curry leaves?&#1/2 cup Onion chopped?&#1.5 tsp Green chillies chopped?&#1/4 cup Tamarind extract?&#1 tsp Jaggery?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1 tsp Salt?&#2 tsp girmit masala powder Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding mustard, cumin, coriander seeds, cinnamon and cloves. Dry roast them for few couple of minutes. Transfer them to mixer and powder finely. Keep this masala powder aside till use.?&#?&#Take roasted gram in a mixer jar and powder it as well. Next heat a pan with oil, mustard, cumin seeds and curry leaves. Saute till the mustard splutter.?&#?&#When mustard splutters, add chopped onion and green chillies. Saute till onion turns translucent. Then include tamarind water.?&#?&#Add turmeric powder, salt, jaggery and let it boil. Next add the girmit masala powder and cook for few seconds.?&#?&#The mixture thickens a bit. Switch off and keep the girmit masala aside. Next in a bowl take puffed rice.?&#?&#Add chopped onion, tomato, 1/4 cup of girmit masala and roasted gram powder. Mix it well.?&#?&#Tasty and spicy girmit is ready to serve with tea or coffee.
Coconut Chutney Powder | Coconut Chutney Pudi August 13, 2019 5 mins 10 mins 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Coconut-chutney-powder-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian, Karnataka 50 gm Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/coconut-chutney-powder-coconut-chutney-pudi 3 tsp Oil?&#1 tsp Mustard seeds?&#2 tbsp Split black gram (urad dal)?&#5 nos. Red chillies?&#1 Cup Fresh coconut grated?&#1/4 tsp Asafoetida (hing) Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding mustard seeds, split black gram, red chillies and roast constantly in medium flame. The lentils turn slightly brown, then transfer and let it cool.?&#?&#Add grated coconut to the same pan and roast till it becomes moisture free. It may take few minutes to get dry and turn little brown. Switch off once done.?&#?&#Take initially roasted ingredients in a mixer. Add tamarind, salt and powder coarsely.?&#?&#Include roasted coconut and asafoetida to the same mixer and whir it again.?&#?&#Coconut chutney powder is ready to serve. It pairs well with idli and dosa as side dish.
Uttappa | Uttappam | Vegetable Uttappa August 9, 2019 10 hrs 5 mins 20 mins 10 hrs 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uttappa-uttappam-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian 20 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/uttappa-uttappam-vegetable-uttappa 2 cups Rice?&#1/2 cup Split black gram (urad dal)?&#1 tsp Fenugreek seeds?&#1/2 cup Rice flakes?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#For topping?&#?&#1 no. Onion chopped?&#1/2 cup Carrot grated?&#1/4 cup Tomato chopped?&#1/4 cup Coriander leaves chopped?&#1/4 tsp Salt Instructions?&#?&#Rinse the raw rice, lentils and rice flakes separately with enough water. Soak them separately for 2 to 3 hours. Rice flakes can be soaked for just 20 minutes.?&#?&#Drain all the water from lentils and transfer to mixer. Grind it to fine and fluffy batter adding water as needed. Transfer the batter to bowl.?&#?&#Next add soaked rice to the same mixer and grind finely include water as necessary. Transfer this batter to the same bowl.?&#?&#Finally, add soaked rice flakes and grind finely. Mix this with other batter and let it ferment for 8-10 hours.?&#?&#After the fermentation, the batter would have raised in volume. Now add salt and mix.?&#?&#For topping, take all veggies onion, carrot, tomato and coriander leaves in a bowl. Mix them with little salt. Next, heat tawa smearing some oil. Pour a ladle ful of batter at the center.?&#?&#Spread it little thicker and top it with veggies. Press the veggies on top so that they get inside uttappa. Flip and cook the other side after few seconds.?&#?&#Healthy and filling breakfast uttappa is ready to serve with coconut chutney.
Stuffed Mirchi Bajji | Stuffed Menasinakai Bajji August 1, 2019 15 mins 20 mins 35 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/stuffed-mirchi-bajji-150x150.jpg Snack Indian 10 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/stuffed-mirchi-bajji-stuffed-menasinakai-bajji 10 nos. Big chillies?&#For stuffing?&#?&#2 nos. Potato?&#1/2 cup Onion chopped?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1/2 tsp Turmeric powder?&#2 tbsp Coriander leaves chopped?&#2 tsp Lemon juice?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp White lentils?&#1/2 tsp Chickpea lentils?&#Few Curry leaves?&#For batter?&#?&#1.5 cup Gram flour?&#1/2 cup Rice flour?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder- 3/4 tsp?&#Water as needed?&#1/4 tsp Baking soda optional Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding oil, mustard seeds, lentils and curry leaves. When mustard splutters, include chopped onion and saute till translucent. Add green chillies and turmeric powder.?&#?&#Next include cooked and mashed potato and salt. Mix everything well. Finally add coriander leaves and squeeze some lemon. Stuffing is ready. Next slit the bajji chillies and remove all seeds.?&#?&#Next in a bowl, add gram flour. rice flour, salt and red chilly powder. Give a quick mix.?&#?&#Include water little by little and prepare slightly thicker batter. The consistency should be like dosa batter. Meanwhile heat some oil in a heavy bottom pan.?&#?&#Next, take the slit chillies and fill with potato stuffing. Keep the chillies ready for deep frying. Dip a stuffed chilly in gram flour batter and carefully drop in to hot oil.?&#?&#Deep fry the chillies till they turn golden brown and drain over a kitchen tissue.?&#?&#Very tempting stuffed mirchi bajji is ready to serve with hot tea and coffee.
Valval | Yogiratna | Konkani Curry July 28, 2019 20 mins 15 mins 35 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Valval-Konkani-curry-150x150.jpg Side Dish Karnataka 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/valval-yogiratna-konkani-curry 1/2 cup Mangalore Cucumber chopped?&#1/2 cup Ash gourd chopped?&#1/2 cup Ivy gourd (Tendly) chopped?&#1 cup Pumpkin chopped?&#1/2 cup Sweet potato chopped?&#2 tbsp Cashews?&#1 tbsp Maida flour?&#1 cup Coconut?&#3 nos. Green chillies?&#1 tsp Salt?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Cumin seeds?&#Few Curry leaves Instructions?&#?&#Initially add cubes of Mangalore cucumber, ash gourd and Ivygourd to the cooking pan. Add half a cup of water and cook covered. When these veggies cook halfway, include chopped pumpkin, sweet potato and cashews.?&#?&#Continue cooking till all the veggies are cooked soft. Meanwhile add maida flour and little water in a small bowl and mix together. It should be lump free.?&#?&#Next, take fresh coconut and half cup of water in a mixer. Grind together to fine paste. Pour over strainer and squeeze to extract thick coconut milk. Grind this squeezed coconut again with some water and extract thin coconut milk.?&#?&#Keep aside both coconut milk. Add some salt and slit green chillies to cooking veggies.?&#?&#When the veggies are perfectly cooked, add thin maida paste and mix well. Maida gives creamy and thick consistency. Next add thin coconut milk and cook for a few minutes.?&#?&#Finally add thick coconut milk and bring it to boil. Switch off once done. Heat a tempering pan with all the ingredients under 'to temper' list and when they sizzle pour over the curry.?&#?&#Creamy and coconut flavored valval is ready to be served with rice.
Vegetable Bonda | Veg Bonda Recipe July 24, 2019 20 mins 20 mins 40 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/easy-vegetable-bonda-veg-bonda-150x150.jpg Snack Indian 10 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/vegetable-bonda-veg-bonda-recipe 1 cup Potato cubed?&#3/4 cup Beans chopped?&#1/2 cup Carrot chopped?&#1/2 cup Beetroot cubed?&#1/4 cup Peas?&#1/2 cup Onion chopped?&#1 tsp Ginger chopped?&#1 tsp Green chillies chopped?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1/2 tsp Turmeric powder?&#1 tsp Garam masala?&#1 tsp Coriander powder?&#1 tsp Cumin powder?&#1 tbsp Coriander leaves chopped?&#2 tsp Lemon juice?&#3 cup Cooking Oil to deep fry?&#To Temper?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Cumin seeds?&#For batter?&#?&#1.5 cup Gram flour?&#1/2 cup Rice flour?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder Instructions?&#?&#Take all the veggies(potato, carrot, beans, beetroot and peas) in a vessel and add salt to it. Pressure cook the veggies for 5 whistles or until soft. Meanwhile heat a pan with oil, mustard seeds and cumin seeds. When they splutter include ginger, green chillies, onion and saute.?&#?&#When the onion turn translucent add salt, turmeric powder, garam masala, coriander powder and cumin powder. Saute well.?&#?&#Next include all cooked veggies and mash them together.?&#?&#Add coriander leaves and squeeze lemon. Mix well and make lemon sized balls out of it. Keep aside till use.?&#?&#Next in a wide bowl add gram flour, rice flour, salt and red chilly powder. Give a quick mix. Adding water incrementally, make batter which is bit thicker in consistency.?&#?&#Heat oil in a heavy bottom wok. And take the stuffing ball, dip it in gram flour batter such that batter covers it completely. Slowly drop this in to hot oil and deep fry till golden brown. Once done, remove and drain on kitchen tissue.?&#?&#Wonderful snack vegetable bonda is ready to serve with tea.
Wheat Flour Laddu | Wheat laddo | Atta laddo July 20, 2019 10 mins 10 mins 20 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Easy-wheat-flour-laddu-150x150.jpg Dessert Karnataka 8 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/wheat-flour-laddu-atta-laddo 1 cup Wheat flour?&#1/2 cup Sugar?&#1/4 cup Ghee?&#2 tbsp Raisins Instructions?&#?&#Initially, take sugar in a mixer jar and powder it finely. Keep it aside. Next heat a pan and add wheat flour.?&#?&#Dry roast the flour with constant stirring for about 3 minutes. Next add ghee and continue stirring.?&#?&#As you stir, wheat flour absorbs all the ghee and then becomes moist. Slowly changes color. When the wheat flour turns golden brown and becomes aromatic, switch off flame.?&#?&#Transfer the roasted wheat flour in to a bowl and let cool down slightly. Then include powdered sugar and mix.?&#?&#In a tempering pan, add ghee and raisins. Roast them for few seconds and pour over laddu mix. Combine everything with your fingers and divide it in to 8 equal parts. Shape each portion like laddu.?&#?&#Easy and delicious wheat flour laddu is ready to serve.
Stuffed Idli | Potato Stuffed Idli Recipe July 16, 2019 9 hrs 30 mins 9 hrs 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Potato-stuffed-idli-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian 24 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/stuffed-idli-potato-stuffed-idli-recipe 1 cup Split black gram lentils (urad dal)?&#2 cups Idli rava?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#For Stuffing?&#?&#2 tsp Oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp White lentils?&#1/2 tsp Chickpea lentils?&#Few Curry leaves?&#1/2 cup Onion chopped?&#2 nos. Green chillies?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#2 cups Mashed potato?&#1 tsp Salt?&#2 tsp Lemon juice?&#1 tbsp Coriander leaves Instructions?&#?&#Take the black gram lentils (urad dal) in a bowl and rinse it well with enough water. Soak it for about 2-3 hours. Take idli rava in another bowl and soak it with enough water for about 20 minutes.?&#?&#Drain all the water from soaked lentils and transfer it to mixer. Add half cup of water and grind to fine and fluffy batter.?&#?&#Transfer it to a vessel. Next, squeeze water from soaked idli rava and add it to lentil batter. Mix them together.?&#?&#Keep the batter covered for fermentation for about 8 hours. Next add salt to the fermented batter. And Keep it ready.?&#?&#Next for stuffing, heat a pan with oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds and lentils. Saute till they splutter. Next add curry leaves, green chillies and onion. Continue sauteing till onion turns translucent.?&#?&#Add turmeric powder, cooked potatoes, salt and mix well. Finally add coriander leaves and squeeze lemon over it. Stuffing is ready now. Take the idli plate, pour little idli batter in to each depression. Add a tbsp of stuffing at the center of each.?&#?&#Again cover the stuffing with idli batter. Keep the idli plate in steamer and steam it for 10 minutes. Remove the idli and repeat the process with rest of the batter.?&#?&#Stuffed idli is ready to be served with coconut chutney and sambar.
Rava Ash Gourd Dosa | Winter Melon Dosa July 12, 2019 3 hrs 15 mins 10 mins 3 hrs 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Easy-rava-ash-gourd-dosa-150x150.jpg Breakfast Karnataka 6 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/rava-ash-gourd-dosa-winter-melon-dosa 1 cup Fine rava(semolina)?&#1/2 cup Ash gourd grated?&#1/2 cup Coconut?&#3/4 tsp Salt?&#1.5 cup Water?&#Few tsp Oil to drizzle Instructions?&#?&#Take rava in a bowl and add 1.5 cup of water to it. Let it soak for 15 minutes.?&#?&#Next grate ash gourd using a fine grater and collect 1/2 cup of it. Add grated ash gourd and coconut to a mixer.?&#?&#Include soaked rava also to the mixer and grind together. Fine batter is ready. Let it ferment for 3 hours.?&#?&#Next, add salt and mix well. Meanwhile, heat a griddle smearing some oil over it.?&#?&#Pour the batter at the center of the griddle and spread very thin dosa. Let it cook covered for 3 minutes. Flip over and cook again for few seconds. Remove and serve with chutney.?&#?&#Very soft and delicious rava ash gourd dosa is ready to serve.
Madli | Madali | A North Karnataka Sweet July 8, 2019 25 mins 10 mins 35 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/madli-Madali-150x150.jpg Dessert Karnataka 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/madli-madali-a-north-karnataka-sweet 1 cup Wheat flour?&#1/4 cup Fine rava?&#1 tbsp Gram flour?&#1/4 tsp Salt?&#1/2 cup Jaggery?&#2 tsp White sesame seeds?&#1 tsp Poppy seeds?&#1/2 tsp cardamom powder?&#1/2 tsp Dry ginger powder?&#1/4 cup Desiccated coconut?&#2 tsp Roasted gram Instructions?&#?&#Initially roast poppy seeds and sesame seeds, keep aside till use. In a wide bowl add wheat flour, fine rava, gram flour and salt together. Give a quick mix. Adding water incrementally, knead a stiff dough. It should be stiffer than normal chapati dough.?&#?&#Let the dough rest for 15 minutes. Pinch a lemon sized ball and roll it like chapati dusting enough flour. It should be rolled bit thicker. Repeat the process with rest of the dough.?&#?&#Cook the chapati over hot skillet. You could see some brown spots both sides after cooking perfectly. When it is still warm, fold it many times lengthwise. And using rolling pin, press to break.?&#?&#Transfer all the broken chapati in to a mixer and whirl for a minute to get coarse powder. Next include jaggery and whirl again.?&#?&#Madli mixture is ready. Transfer this to a wide bowl. Add cardamom powder, ginger powder, roasted gram, roasted sesame, poppy seeds and desiccated copra. Combine everything well.?&#?&#The North Karnataka special Madli is ready to be served with milk and ghee.
Red Chilly Chutney | North Karnataka Style Red Chutney July 4, 2019 15 mins 3 mins 18 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Red-chilly-chutney-easy-150x150.jpg Chutney Karnataka 50 gms Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/red-chilly-chutney-north-karnataka-style-red-chutney 15 nos. Red Chilly (Kashmiri or Byadagi variety)?&#1 no. Onion?&#1 tsp Tamarind paste?&#1 tsp Jaggery powder?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1 tbsp Coriander leaves?&#Few Curry leaves?&#2 nos. Garlic?&#To temper?&#?&#1 tbsp Oil?&#1 tsp Mustard seeds Instructions?&#?&#Take a cup of water in a pan, bring it to rolling boil. When it is boiling, include red chillies and switch off. Let the chillies soak in hot water for about 15 minutes.?&#?&#After soaking time chillies would have turned soft, drain all the water from them. Keep aside. Next take 1/2 cup of chopped onion in a pan and saute till it turns translucent.?&#?&#Next add soaked red chillies, tamarind, jaggery, salt, cumin seeds, curry leaves, coriander leaves, garlic, and sauteed onion in to mixer jar.?&#?&#Grind all the ingredients together in to thick paste. Next heat a pan with oil and mustard seeds. Let the mustard sizzle, then include ground chutney and saute for 2 minutes. Switch off.?&#?&#Spicy and gorgeously colored red chilly chutney is ready to serve with any rotti.
Ripe Mango Curry | Ripe Mango Saasmi Recipe June 30, 2019 10 mins 2 mins 12 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/ripe-mango-curry-150x150.jpg Side Dish Karnataka 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/ripe-mango-curry-ripe-mango-saasmi-recipe 3 nos Ripe wild mangoes?&#1/2 cup Coconut?&#1 no. Red chilly?&#1/4 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Jaggery optional?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp Coconut oil?&#1/2 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/2 tsp Black gram lentils?&#1 no. Red chilly broken?&#Few nos Curry leaves Instructions?&#?&#Peel off the wild mangoes and squeeze all the pulp. You can even include the seeds.?&#?&#Next take the coconut, red chilly and mustard seeds in a mixer. Include some water and grind them together in to fine paste.?&#?&#Add the ground masala to mango pulp. Add salt and jaggery as well. Mix everything together.?&#?&#Finally heat a tempering pan and add all the ingredients under "to temper" list. When mustard splutter, pour the tempering over mango curry. Tangy and sweet mango curry is ready to be served with rice.
Mango Coconut Halwa | Mango Halwa Recipe June 23, 2019 10 mins 30 mins 40 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Mango-halwa-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian, Karnataka 10 pieces Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/mango-coconut-halwa-mango-halwa-recipe 2 cup Mango Pulp?&#1/2 cup Jaggery?&#3/4 cup Fresh coconut?&#1/4 cup Rava (semolina)?&#1/4 tsp cardamom powder?&#3 tsp Ghee Instructions?&#?&#Take mango pulp in a mixer and whirl it for minute to get thick mango puree. Transfer the puree to a pan and add jaggery to it.?&#?&#Stir the mixture in medium flame for about 10 minutes. The jaggery melts and combines well with mango puree. When the mixture becomes slightly thick include coconut.?&#?&#Continue cooking coconut in medium flame with constant stirring for about 5 minutes. Next include rava and cardamom powder.?&#?&#As you cook with constant stirring, the mixture comes together like mass. Add ghee at this stage and keep mixing. After few minutes the mango coconut halwa leaves the pan. Right then switch off flame.?&#?&#Now transfer halwa mixture to the tray lined with parchment paper and spread evenly. Let it rest for 20 minutes to harden. After that mark pieces and relish.?&#?&#Delicious mango coconut halwa is ready to serve.
Ragi Malt | Ragi Porridge | Weight Loss Recipe June 18, 2019

Curd Rice | Mosaranna | A South Indian Meal June 9, 2019 10 mins 5 mins 15 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Curd-rice-Mosaranna-150x150.jpg Main Course Indian 2 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/curd-rice-mosaranna-recipe 1 cup Cooked rice?&#1.5 cups Yogurt?&#1/4 cup Milk?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1/4 cup pomegranate seeds optional?&#1 tbsp Grapes optional?&#To temper?&#?&#2 tsp oil or ghee?&#1/2 tsp mustard seeds?&#1/4 tsp cumin seeds?&#1/2 tsp white lentils?&#1/2 tsp chickpea lentils?&#Few curry leaves?&#2 nos. red chillies?&#1.5 tsp ginger chopped?&#1 tbsp broken cashews optional Instructions?&#?&#In a pan add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, lentils, red chillies and curry leaves. Masala Tea | Badam Tea | How to make Tea 2 ways June 4, 2019 5 mins 5 mins 10 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Masala-tea-150x150.jpg Drinks Indian 3 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/masala-tea-badam-tea-how-to-make-tea-2-ways For Masala Tea?&#?&#1.5 cups Water?&#3 tsp Tea powder?&#4 tsp Sugar?&#1.5 cups Milk?&#1 tbsp Grated ginger?&#2 nos. Cardamom?&#1/2 inch piece Cinnamon?&#For Badam Tea?&#?&#1 tbsp Almond (badam)?&#1.5 cup Milk?&#1.5 cup Water?&#3 tsp Tea powder?&#4 tsp Sugar?&#2 nos. Cardamom (crushed) Instructions?&#?&#Masala tea preparation?&#?&#In a saucepan, heat water. Add tea powder and sugar to it. Let it boil.?&#?&#Then include milk and bring it to rolling boil. Add grated ginger.?&#?&#Next add cardamom and cinnamon piece. Stir once and let it boil. Strain masala tea and serve with biscuits.?&#?&#Badam tea preparation?&#?&#Take almonds in a mixer and powder it finely.?&#?&#Next in a sauce pan heat milk. As it boild, include powdered almond. Stir and boil it for a minute in simmer.?&#?&#Next heat water in a separate sauce pan. Add tea powder, sugar and crushed cardamom to it. Bring it to rolling boil.?&#?&#Strain badam milk (prepared in above step) in to it. Now boil badam milk in tea mixture for a minute and strain.?&#?&#Serve badam flavored badam tea with biscuits.
Sabudana Dosa | Sago Dosa Recipe May 31, 2019 12 hrs 10 mins 12 hrs 10 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/yummy-sabudana-dosa-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian, Karnataka 10 nos. Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/sabudana-dosa-sago-dosa-recipe 1/2 cup Sabudana (Sago)?&#1 cup Whisked yogurt or buttermilk?&#1.5 cup Rice flour?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#Water as needed Instructions?&#?&#Take sabudana in a bowl and rinse it well with enough water. Add whisked yogurt to it.?&#?&#Soak it for 4 hours. The sabudana would have raised in volume. Transfer it to a mixer or wet grinder.?&#?&#Grind it very finely and transfer the batter to big bowl. Add rice flour and mix well.?&#?&#Include water as needed and get the it to dosa batter consistency. Cover and let it ferment for 8 to 10 hours.?&#?&#After fermentation, add salt and mix well. Heat a dosa griddle and smear some oil. Pour a ladle full of batter at the center. Do not spread.?&#?&#Cover and cook in medium flame for 3 minutes. You can notice porous texture as it cooks. Remove when done and serve with chutney and sambar.?&#?&#Repeat the process with rest of the batter. Crispy and soft sabudana dosa is ready to serve.
Pineapple Raita | Creamy and Delicious May 28, 2019 5 mins 5 mins 10 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Pineapple-raita-150x150.jpg Side Dish Indian 3 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/pineapple-raita-recipe 1 cup Yogurt?&#1/2 cup Pineapple cubes?&#1/2 tsp Black salt?&#1/2 tsp Cumin powder?&#1/2 tsp Sugar Instructions?&#?&#In a sauce pan add some water and pineapple cubes. Spicy Shankarpali | Khara Shankarpali | Shankarpali May 23, 2019 20 mins 10 mins 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/spicy-shankarpali-150x150.jpg Snack Indian, Karnataka 200 gm Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/spicy-shankarpali-khara-shankarpali 1.5 cup All purpose flour(maida)?&#2 tbsp Medium rava (fine sooji)?&#1 tsp Cumin seeds?&#1 tsp Salt?&#1 tsp Red chilly powder?&#Water as needed?&#2 tbsp Hot oil?&#2 cups Cooking Oil Instructions?&#?&#In a wide bowl, take maida, fine rava and cumin seeds.?&#?&#Also add salt, red chilly powder. Give a quick mix. Meanwhile heat 2 tbsp of oil in a pan and add to the flour.?&#?&#Crumble the flour such that it holds shape. Adding water little by little, knead a stiff dough. Cover with damp cloth and let it rest for 10 minutes.?&#?&#After the resting the time, knead it once again. Divide the dough in to two and roll it to thin disc. Mark pieces like diamond using pizza cutter and separate the shankarpali.?&#?&#Heat up oil in a wok and as it heats up, drop the shankarpali in to hot oil. Deep fry till golden brown and drain the excess oil.?&#?&#Crispy snack spicy shankarpali is ready to serve with tea.
Fruits Chaat | Healthy Fruit Chaat Recipe May 18, 2019 10 mins 0 mins 10 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Fruits-chaat-150x150.jpg Chaat Indian 4 people Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/fruits-chaat-recipe.html 2 no. Banana?&#1 no. Orange?&#1 no. Pineapple Squash | Pineapple Concentrate Recipe May 10, 2019 10 mins 15 mins
https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Pineapple-squash-150x150.jpg Drinks Indian 500 ml Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/05/pineapple-squash-pineapple-concentrate-recipe.html 1 no. Pineapple?&#½ cup Sugar?&#1/2 cup Water?&#1 tbsp Lemon juice Instructions?&#?&#Peel off the pineapple, discard the thick middle portion. Chop it in to big chunks. Take all the pieces in blender.?&#?&#Add some water and grind it to thick juice. Strain over fine sieve and discard the residue.?&#?&#Next heat a pan adding sugar and 1/2 cup of water. Cook in medium flame and obtain syrup of one string consistency.?&#?&#Pour the pineapple juice in to sugar syrup and continue cooking for 10 minutes. It will boil and become thick.?&#?&#Let this cool off completely. Add lemon juice and mix well. Store this pineapple squash in a bottle.?&#?&#To make juice add 1/4 cup of pineapple squash and 3/4 cup of water in to a glass. Mix and serve chilled.
Mango Thokku | Raw Mango Thokku Recipe May 5, 2019 10 mins 15 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Tasty-mango-thokku-150x150.jpg Side Dish Karnataka 100 gms Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/05/mango-thokku-raw-mango-thokku-recipe.html 3 nos. Raw mango?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#2 tsp Red chilly powder?&#1.5 tsp Salt?&#1/8 tsp Fenugreek seeds?&#1/8 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1.5 tbsp Oil?&#To temper?&#?&#1 tbsp Oil?&#1/4 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1/4 tsp Asafoetida Instructions?&#?&#Preparation?&#?&#Wash the mangoes under running water and pat dry them. Peel the skin off and grate all the mangoes.?&#?&#Method?&#?&#Measure 1.5 cups of grated mango and keep aside. Next dry roast the fenugreek and mustard seeds till they splutter. Powder them using mortar and pestle. Keep aside.?&#?&#Next heat a pan and add the tempering ingredients. Let the mustard seeds splutter. Then include grated mangoes.?&#?&#Saute the mangoes for 3 minutes. Add turmeric powder, red chilly powder and salt. Mix and saute well.?&#?&#Next add 1 tbsp of oil and continue sauteing. The oil is absorbed by mangoes. Next add roasted fenugreek and mustard powder.?&#?&#Continue sauteing and again include remaining oil. The thokku comes together and leaves the pan now. Switch off and let it cool down.?&#?&#Store the mango thokku in dry container and serve with curd rice.
Karachi Halwa | Bombay Halwa | Corn flour Halwa Recipe April 30, 2019 5 mins 40 mins 45 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Karachi-Halwa-150x150.jpg Dessert Indian 12 pieces Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/04/karachi-halwa-bombay-halwa-corn-flour-halwa-recipe.html 1/2 cup Corn flour?&#1.5 cup Water?&#3 drops Food color of your choice?&#5 tbsp Ghee?&#1 tsp Lemon juice?&#1/4 tsp Cardamom powder?&#1/ 4 cup Cashews( broken)?&#2 tbsp Almonds broken optional?&#For sugar syrup?&#?&#1.25 to 1.5 cups Sugar?&#1 cup Water Instructions?&#?&#Preparation?&#?&#Take cornflour in a wide bowl and add 1.5 cups of water to it. ?&#?&#Whisk well such that no lumps are retained in the mixture. Include food color and mix that as well. Keep aside till use.?&#?&#Method?&#?&#In a pan add sugar and a cup of water. Cook it in medium till sugar dissolves. ?&#?&#When sugar syrup boils include the corn flour mixture while continuously stirring with other hand.?&#?&#Cook it in low flame with constant stirring. The mixture begins to thicken. Then add lemon juice and continue cooking. When mixture turns glossy, add 1 tbsp ghee.?&#?&#The ghee is completely absorbed by the halwa mixture. Again add 1 tbsp of ghee and continue stirring. This process is to be repeated till all the ghee is used up. Next include cardamom powder, broken cashews and mix well as you cook.?&#?&#Finally the halwa mixture forms a lump and leaves the pan. It's the time to switch off and transfer to ghee greased tray. Let it rest for half an hour and then cut in to pieces.?&#?&#Soft, glossy textured corn flour halwa is ready to serve.
Rava Idli Mix | Instant Rava Idli Mix Recipe April 27, 2019

12 idlis Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/04/rava-idli-mix-instant-rava-idli-mix-recipe.html 3 cups Rava (Semolina)?&#1 tbsp Cooking oil?&#1 tsp Mustard seeds?&#1 tso White lentils?&#1.5 tsp Chickpea lentils?&#Few Curry leaves?&#1/4 tsp Turmeric powder?&#3 tsp Salt?&#1.5 tsp Baking soda?&#To make rava idli?&#?&#1 cup Rava idli mix?&#1.5 cup Whisked yogurt?&#1/4 cup Water?&#1/4 cup Coriander leaves Instructions?&#?&#Heat a pan adding oil, mustard seeds, lentils and curry leaves. Benne Dosa | Benne Dose | Davanagere Benne Dosa April 21, 2019 8 hrs 20 mins 8 hrs 20 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Benne-dosa-benne-dose-150x150.jpg Breakfast Indian 15 - 20 dosa Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/04/benne-dosa-benne-dose-davanagere-benne-dosa.html Dosa rice- 3 cups?&#White lentis split blackgram lentils- 3/4 cup?&#Fenugreek seeds - 1.5 tsp?&#Rice flakes - 3/4 cup?&#Rice powder- 1 tbsp?&#Salt- 2.5 tsp?&#Sugar- 1 tsp?&#Butter - 1/4 cup?&#For chutney?&#?&#Coconut- 3/4 cup?&#Green chillies- 2 nos.?&#Salt- 1/2 tsp?&#Cardamom- 1 no.?&#Cloves - 1 no.?&#For potato masala?&#?&#Cooked potato - 3 nos.?&#Onion - 1 no. sliced?&#Green chilles - 2no.?&#Salt- 1 tsp?&#To temper?&#?&#Cooking oil - 2 tsp?&#Mustard seeds - 1/4 tsp?&#Cumin seeds - 1/4 tsp?&#Curry leaves - Few Instructions?&#?&#Preparation?&#?&#Rinse white lentils and fenugreek seeds together, add enough water and soak for 3 hours. Similarly rinse dosa rice with enough water and soak it with fresh water for about 3 hours.?&#?&#Method?&#?&#Rinse and soak rice flakes for about 10 minutes before grinding. Next take drained lentils in a mixer and grind finely adding water as needed.?&#?&#Transfer the lentil batter to a wide bowl. Next take soaked dosa rice in the mixer and grind it finely as well.?&#?&#Transfer the rice batter to same bowl. Finely add soaked rice flakes and grind it to fine batter. Transfer this also the bowl. Mix everything well.?&#?&#Let this batter ferment for about 8 to 10 hours at warm place. After fermentation the batter would have raised. Add salt and rice powder to it. Mix well and the batter is ready.?&#?&#To make chutney, take all the ingredients under "For chutney" list and grind coarsely. Chutney for benne dosa is ready.?&#?&#Next heat a pan adding oil, mustard and cumin seeds. As they splutter add curry leaves and sliced onion. Saute till onion turn translucent. Then include green chillies, mashed potato and salt. Mix them well.?&#?&#Next heat tawa and smear some oil over it. Sprinkle some water and wipe it off. Pour a ladle full of batter at the center and spread like dosa. After 10 seconds, apply butter generously all over the dosa and let it cook.?&#?&#When it cooks to slightly brown, loosen the edge and remove from tawa. Turn the dosa and cook for 2 seconds. Remove and serve hot with chutney and masala.?&#?&#Repeat the process with rest of the batter. Benne dosa Yum!?&#?&#
Jackfruit Fritters | Jackfruit MuLka using Wheat Flour April 18, 2019 15 mins 10 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/jackfruit-fritters-150x150.jpg

Next include roasted sesame seeds.?&#?&#Add wheat flour and mix well to smooth dough. Cashew Pakoda | Kaju Pakoda | Godambi Pakoda April 13, 2019 15 mins 10 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/cashew-pakoda-150x150.jpg

You can roast lentils and powder finely. I have used store bought urad dal flour.?&#?&#In a mortar and pestle, add coriander, carom and fennel seeds. Halasina Kayi Palya | Raw Jackfruit Palya Recipe April 2, 2019 15 mins 15 mins 30 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Halasina-kayi-palya-authentic-way-150x150.jpg
5 to 6 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/04/halasina-kayi-palya-raw-jackfruit-palya-recipe.html Raw jackfruit small- 1 no.?&#Turmeric powder- 1/4 tsp?&#Salt- 2 tsp?&#Jaggery powder - 1.5 tsp?&#Tamarind - Marble sized?&#Fresh coconut - 1/2 cup?&#Mustard seeds - 1 tsp?&#Red chillies- 3 nos.?&#To temper?&#?&#Coconut oil - 3 tsp?&#Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp?&#Split black gram lentils - 1/2 tsp?&#Curry leaves - Few Instructions?&#?&#Preparation?&#?&#Apply enough oil to the palms and peel the thorny skin from raw jackfruit. Aloo Papad | Potato Papad | How to make Papad March 28, 2019 15 mins 10 mins 25 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/ALOO-PAPAD-150x150.jpg
20 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/03/aloo-papad-potato-papad.html Potatoes aloo - 3 to 4 nos.?&#Salt - 1.5 tsp?&#Coriander powder- 1 tsp?&#Cumin powder- 1/2 tsp?&#Mango powder - 1 tsp?&#Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp?&#Corn flakes- 2 tsp?&#Coriander leaves- 2 tbsp?&#Oil - 2 tsp Instructions?&#?&#Preparation?&#?&#Pressure cook the potatoes till soft. I cooked it for 4 whistles and simmered 5 minutes.?&#?&#Method?&#?&#Peel the skin off from cooked potatoes and grate them using fine grater.?&#?&#Transfer the grated potato to wide bowl. Idli with Idli Rava | Soft Idli with Rice Rava March 25, 2019 20 mins 15 mins 35 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/idli-with-idli-rava-150x150.jpg
25 Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/03/idli-with-idli-rava-recipe.html Split blackgram lentils urad dal- 1 cup?&#Idli rava- 2 cups?&#Salt- 1.5 tsp?&#Oil to grease Instructions?&#?&#Method?&#?&#Take the lentils in a wide bowl and rinse it well with enough water. Then soak using fresh water for about 3 hours. Then drain all the water and transfer the lentils to mixer. Transfer it to a wide container.?&#?&#Next, rinse the idli rava with enough water and soak for about 15-12 minutes. Then carefully remove the idli using a spoon.?&#?&#Soft and fluffy idli is ready to serve. I served them in Udupi style with tovve and coconut chutney.?&#?&#
Badanekayi Palya in North Karnataka Style March 21, 2019 20 mins 20 mins 40 mins https://udupi-recipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/badanekayi-palya-in-NK-style-150x150.jpg
Sumana https://udupi-recipes.com/2019/03/badanekayi-palya-north-karnataka-style.html Brinjal badanekayi- 8-10 nos.?&#Onion big sized- 1 nos.?&#Tamarind - lemon sized?&#Jaggery - 1/4 tsp?&#Red chilly powder- 1 tsp?&#To temper?&#?&#Cooking oil - 2 tbsp?&#Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp?&#Split black gram lentils - 1/2 tsp?&#Curry leaves - Few?&#To grind?&#?&#Peanuts- 1/4 cup?&#Fresh coconut- 1/2 cup?&#Green chillies - 3 nos.?&#Garlic- 8 to 10 cloves?&#Onion big sized- 1 nos.?&#Turmeric powder- 1/4 tsp?&#Cumin seeds - 1 tsp?&#Coriander leaves - handful?&#Cooking oil - 2 tbsp Instructions?&#?&#Preparation?&#?&#Peel off the onion and chop it in to small bite sized pieces.
